definition: Yan Xishan (1883-1960), warlord in Shanxi
Yama/gate of village/surname Yan
tin (chemistry)/to bestow/to confer/to grant/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
surname Shan
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: After the overthrow of the Qing dynasty, Shanxi was held by warlord Yan Xishan.
sentences.chinese: 清朝被推翻后，山西被军阀阎锡山占领。

sentences.english: "Cong" people "-Chun Man", that is, "Yuzhou Man" and the "Liao" originated with "Pu" Family.
sentences.chinese: 阎锡山幕僚是民国时期一个重要的军人幕僚群体。

sentences.english: But Yan Hsi-shan was still like a trapped beast.
sentences.chinese: 但是，阎锡山仍然在作困兽之斗。

sentences.english: The old army refers to the troops under Yen Hsi-shan, the Kuomintang warlord in Shansi;
sentences.chinese: 旧军，指国民党山西地方实力派阎锡山指挥的晋绥军。

sentences.english: One column was led by Yan Xishan, and against it we fought the Shangdang Campaign.
sentences.chinese: 一路是阎锡山，我们就手打了个上党战役。

sentences.english: This equally applies to the appraisal of Yan Xishan's localism.
sentences.chinese: 对阎锡山的地方主义的评价亦应如此。

definition: Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek
Fu Zuoyi (1895-1974), Guomindang general, subsequently PRC top general and politician
Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
He Yingqin (1890-1987), senior Guomindang general
Han Fuju (1890-1938), Nationalist Kuomintang (KMT) army general and governor of Shandong, executed by Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石[Jiang3 Jie4 shi2] after he abandoned Jinan to the Japanese
Li Zongren (1891-1969), a leader of Guangxi warlord faction
Bai Chongxi (1893-1966), a leader of Guangxi warlord faction, top Nationalist general, played important role in Chiang Kaishek's campaigns 1926-1949
Zhang Zuolin (c. 1873-1928), warlord of Manchuria 1916-1928
Zhang Xueliang (1901-2001) son of Fengtian clique warlord, then senior general for the Nationalists and subsequently for the People's Liberation Army
Duan Qirui (1864-1936), commander of Beiyang Army under Yuan Shikai, then politician and powerful warlord
Fengtian clique (of northern warlords)
Tang Yulin (1871-1937), minor warlord in northeast China, sometime governor of Chengde 承德, mostly poor in battle but very successful at accumulating personal wealth
Sun Chuanfang (1885-1935) one of the northern warlord, murdered in Tianjin in 1935
north China army, a modernizing Western-style army set up during late Qing, and a breeding ground for the Northern Warlords after the Qinghai revolution
Nationalist government 1920s-1949 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Cao Kun (1862-1938), one of the Northern Warlords
